Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pasty \Pas"ty\, n.; pl. {Pasties}. [OF. past['e], F. p[^a]t['e]. See {Paste}, and cf. {Patty}.] A pie consisting usually of meat wholly surrounded with a crust made of a sheet of paste, and often baked without a dish; a meat pie. ``If ye pinch me like a pasty.'' --Shak. ``Apple pasties.'' --Dickens. [1913 Webster]
A large pasty baked in a pewter platter. --Sir W. Scott. [1913 Webster]
pasties n : a pair of adhesive patches worn to cover the nipples of exotic dancers and striptease performers
